_NOTICE: Fields starting with underscore (_) are COMMENTS ONLY - they are NOT used by the app and will be removed when you save settings in the UI.
_IMPORTANT: Most users should configure settings through the Web UI (Settings tab). This file is provided for reference and advanced users who prefer direct file editing.
_QUICK_START: 1. Copy this file to 'app_settings.json' | 2. Run the app | 3. Go to Settings tab and configure through the UI | 4. Click 'Save Settings' - your configuration will be saved automatically
_SECTION_1_DESCRIPTION: Controls how burndown charts are displayed. All settings configurable in Dashboard tab.
_pert_factor_explanation: Multiplier for optimistic estimates (1.5 = add 50% buffer). Higher = more conservative forecasting. Range: 1.0-3.0. Adjust in Dashboard tab.
_deadline_explanation: Project deadline in YYYY-MM-DD format. Used to show deadline line on charts. Set in Dashboard tab.
_data_points_explanation: Number of weeks to show in velocity chart (default: 12 weeks). Adjust in Dashboard tab.
_milestone_explanation: Optional milestone date (YYYY-MM-DD format). Shows as vertical line on chart when show_milestone is true.
_show_points_explanation: Toggle between showing story points or item counts on charts. true = show points, false = show item counts.
_SECTION_2_DESCRIPTION: Defines which JIRA issues to load. Configure in Items per Week tab using the JQL Editor.
jql_query: project = YOUR_PROJECT AND created >= -12w ORDER BY created DESC
_jql_query_explanation: JIRA Query Language (JQL) query to fetch issues. Example fetches last 12 weeks. Replace YOUR_PROJECT with your project key (e.g., 'KAFKA', 'SPARK'). Edit in Items per Week tab → JQL Editor.
_last_used_data_source_explanation: Tracks whether you're using JIRA or manual CSV data. Automatically set by the app when you load data.
_active_jql_profile_explanation: ID of saved JQL query profile. Managed automatically when you save/load JQL profiles in the UI.
_SECTION_3_DESCRIPTION: REQUIRED: Connection details for your JIRA instance. Configure in Settings → JIRA Configuration tab.

jira_config._base_url_help: Your JIRA URL (e.g., https://jira.atlassian.com). Find this in your browser when you open JIRA. Configure in Settings → JIRA Configuration.
jira_config._api_version_help: JIRA REST API version. Use 'v2' for JIRA Cloud/Server. Rarely needs changing.
jira_config._token_help: JIRA API token for authentication. Generate in JIRA: Profile → Security → API Tokens. NEVER share this token. Stored securely, configure in Settings → JIRA Configuration.
jira_config._cache_size_help: Maximum cache size in megabytes (default: 100). Increase if working with very large projects (1000+ issues).
jira_config._max_results_help: How many issues to fetch per API call (default: 100, max: 100). Affects loading speed for large queries.
jira_config._points_field_help: JIRA custom field ID for story points. Find in JIRA: Admin → Issues → Custom Fields → find 'Story Points' → copy ID (e.g., customfield_10002). Configure in Settings → JIRA Configuration.
jira_config._configured_help: Automatically set to true when you successfully test JIRA connection in the UI. Do not edit manually.
jira_config._last_test_timestamp_help: Timestamp of last successful JIRA connection test. Managed automatically by the app.
jira_config._last_test_success_help: Whether last connection test succeeded. Managed automatically by the app.

_SECTION_4_DESCRIPTION: Maps your JIRA fields to DORA/Flow metrics. Configure in Settings → Field Mappings → Fields tab. Use standard JIRA field names (created, resolutiondate, status, priority, issuetype) or custom field IDs (customfield_XXXXX).
_FIELD_MAPPING_NOTE: The app needs to know which JIRA fields contain the data for metrics calculation. Standard fields work out-of-box. Custom fields require finding the field ID in JIRA Admin.

field_mappings._DORA_METRICS_FIELDS: --- OPTIONAL: Only needed if using DORA metrics (Deployment Frequency, Lead Time, CFR, MTTR) ---
field_mappings._deployment_date_help: JIRA field containing deployment/release date. Default: 'resolutiondate' (when issue was resolved). Can use custom field like 'customfield_11111' if you track actual deployment dates separately.
field_mappings._target_environment_help: JIRA field containing target environment (Production, Staging, Dev). Default: 'environment'. Use custom field if your JIRA has different field name. Used to filter production deployments.
field_mappings._code_commit_date_help: JIRA field for code commit date. Default: 'resolutiondate'. Use custom field if you track commit dates in JIRA.
field_mappings._deployed_to_production_help: JIRA field for production deployment date. Default: 'resolutiondate'. Critical for accurate Lead Time calculation.
field_mappings._incident_detected_help: JIRA field for when incident/bug was detected. Default: 'created' (issue creation date). Used for MTTR calculation.
field_mappings._incident_resolved_help: JIRA field for when incident was resolved. Default: 'resolutiondate'. Used for MTTR calculation.
field_mappings._severity_level_help: JIRA field for bug/incident severity. Default: 'priority'. Used to filter critical incidents in MTTR calculation.
field_mappings._FLOW_METRICS_FIELDS: --- REQUIRED: Needed for Flow metrics (Velocity, Flow Time, Flow Efficiency, Flow Load, Flow Distribution) ---
field_mappings._flow_item_type_help: JIRA field for issue type (Story, Bug, Task, etc.). Default: 'issuetype'. REQUIRED for Flow Distribution to categorize work types.
field_mappings._effort_category_help: OPTIONAL: Custom field for effort categorization (Feature/Bug/Technical Debt/Risk). Replace XXXXX with your field ID. Leave as-is if you don't have this field - app will use issue types instead.
field_mappings._work_started_help: JIRA field for when work started. Default: 'created'. Can use custom field if you track 'In Progress' date separately. Used for Flow Time calculation.
field_mappings._work_completed_help: JIRA field for when work completed. Default: 'resolutiondate'. REQUIRED for all Flow metrics.
field_mappings._completed_date_help: Alias for work_completed_date. Both should point to same field.
field_mappings._status_help: JIRA field for issue status (In Progress, Done, etc.). Default: 'status'. Used for Flow Load (WIP) calculation.

_SECTION_5_DESCRIPTION: Defines which JIRA projects contain DevOps work vs Development work. Configure in Settings → Field Mappings → Projects tab.
_MODE_SELECTION_NOTE: The app has TWO modes: MODE 1 (project-based) when devops_projects is NOT empty, MODE 2 (field-based) when devops_projects IS empty. Most users should use MODE 2 (leave devops_projects empty).
_devops_projects_help: List of JIRA project keys for DevOps/Operations work (e.g., ['OPS', 'INFRA']). Leave EMPTY to use MODE 2 (recommended). Only fill if you have separate DevOps projects and want MODE 1.
_development_projects_help: List of JIRA project keys for Development work (e.g., ['KAFKA', 'SPARK']). Replace YOUR_PROJECT with your actual project key. Used in MODE 1 only.
_SECTION_6_DESCRIPTION: Defines which JIRA issue types represent DevOps tasks, bugs, etc. Configure in Settings → Field Mappings → DevOps tab.
_devops_task_types_help: JIRA issue types for operational/DevOps work (deployments, infrastructure, etc.). Default: Task, Sub-task. Used in MODE 2 for DORA metric classification.
_bug_types_help: JIRA issue types for bugs/defects. Default: Bug. Used to identify production bugs for MTTR and Change Failure Rate.
_production_environment_help: Values in 'target_environment' field that indicate production deployments (e.g., ['Production', 'Prod']). Leave empty to include ALL deployments. Used for filtering production-only deployments in DORA metrics.
_SECTION_7_DESCRIPTION: Maps your JIRA workflow statuses to app concepts. Configure in Settings → Field Mappings → Statuses tab. Use your actual JIRA status names (case-sensitive).
_completion_statuses_help: JIRA statuses that mean work is DONE. Default: Resolved, Closed. Add your custom done statuses (e.g., 'Released', 'Complete'). Used to count completed work in Flow Velocity.
_active_statuses_help: JIRA statuses that mean work is ACTIVE. Default: In Progress, In Review. Add your custom active statuses (e.g., 'Developing', 'Testing'). Used for Flow Efficiency calculation.
_flow_start_statuses_help: JIRA statuses that mean work has STARTED (not just backlog). Default: In Progress. Used to determine when Flow Time clock starts.
_wip_statuses_help: JIRA statuses that count as Work In Progress. Default: In Progress, In Review, Testing. Add all statuses between 'To Do' and 'Done'. Used for Flow Load metric.
_SECTION_8_DESCRIPTION: Maps JIRA issue types to Flow Framework work types (Feature/Defect/Technical Debt/Risk). Configure in Settings → Field Mappings → Flow Types tab. These defaults work for most teams.

Feature._issue_types_help: JIRA issue types that represent new features/capabilities. Adjust based on your JIRA setup.
Feature._effort_categories_help: OPTIONAL: If you have 'effort_category' custom field, specify values here (e.g., ['Feature Work', 'Enhancement']). Empty array means ALL issues of these types count as Features.

Defect._issue_types_help: JIRA issue types for bugs/defects. Default: Bug.
Defect._effort_categories_help: OPTIONAL: Effort category values for defects. Empty array means all Bugs count as Defects.

Technical_Debt._issue_types_help: JIRA issue types for technical debt/refactoring. Default: Task, Sub-task. Adjust if you use different types for tech debt (e.g., 'Tech Debt', 'Refactoring').
Technical_Debt._effort_categories_help: OPTIONAL: Effort category values for technical debt.

Risk._issue_types_help: JIRA issue types for risk mitigation (security, research, testing). Default: Test, Security, Spike. Add your custom types (e.g., 'Security Review', 'POC').
Risk._effort_categories_help: OPTIONAL: Effort category values for risk work.

_SETUP_INSTRUCTIONS: How to configure this app (RECOMMENDED: Use the Web UI)
_STEP_1: JIRA Connection: Settings → JIRA Configuration tab → Enter JIRA URL, API token, Story Points field → Click 'Test Connection'
_STEP_2: Field Mappings: Settings → Field Mappings → Fields tab → Map JIRA fields to metrics (use defaults if unsure)
_STEP_3: Projects: Settings → Field Mappings → Projects tab → Enter your project keys (e.g., KAFKA, SPARK) in 'Development Projects'
_STEP_4: Statuses: Settings → Field Mappings → Statuses tab → Enter your JIRA status names (case-sensitive)
_STEP_5: Flow Types: Settings → Field Mappings → Flow Types tab → Map issue types to work types (defaults usually work)
_STEP_6: DevOps (Optional): Settings → Field Mappings → DevOps tab → Configure only if you have separate DevOps projects
_STEP_7: Test: Items per Week tab → Click 'Update Data' → Wait for JIRA data to load
_STEP_8: Calculate: DORA & Flow Metrics tab → Click 'Calculate Metrics' → View your metrics!
_STEP_9: Save: Settings tab → Click 'Save Settings' → Configuration saved to app_settings.json
_FINDING_CUSTOM_FIELDS: How to find JIRA custom field IDs (needed for points_field and optional effort_category)
_METHOD_1: In JIRA Admin: Admin → Issues → Custom Fields → Find your field (e.g., 'Story Points') → Click settings gear → Edit → Look at URL: customfield_10002
_METHOD_2: In JIRA Issue: Open any issue → Click '...' → Configure → Look at field names in browser inspector (F12)
_METHOD_3: Use JIRA API: Go to https://your-jira.com/rest/api/2/field and search for your field name → copy 'id' value
_COMMON_FIELDS: Story Points: often customfield_10002 or customfield_10016 | Environment: often customfield_10002 | Sprint: often customfield_10001
_MODE_1_DESCRIPTION: Project-Based: Separate DevOps projects from Development projects. Use when you have dedicated DevOps/Operations projects (e.g., INFRA, OPS) separate from development work. DORA metrics calculated from DevOps projects, Flow metrics from Development projects.
_MODE_1_CONFIG: Set devops_projects to non-empty list (e.g., ['OPS', 'INFRA']) AND set development_projects (e.g., ['KAFKA', 'SPARK'])
_MODE_2_DESCRIPTION: Field-Based: All issues in same projects, classified by issue type and fields. Use when DevOps and Development work live in same projects (most teams). DORA metrics calculated from issues matching devops_task_types, Flow metrics from all issues.
_MODE_2_CONFIG: Leave devops_projects EMPTY [] AND set development_projects (app auto-selects MODE 2)
_WHICH_MODE: Use MODE 2 (field-based) unless you have completely separate DevOps projects. MODE 2 is simpler and works for most teams.
_NO_DATA: If metrics show 'No data': Check that issues exist in your JQL query date range, verify field mappings match your JIRA fields, ensure statuses match exactly (case-sensitive)
_CONNECTION_FAILED: If JIRA connection fails: Verify base_url is correct (include https://), check API token is valid (generate new one if needed), ensure you have permission to access JIRA API
_WRONG_METRICS: If metrics seem wrong: Verify completion_statuses include all your 'done' statuses, check flow_type_mappings match your issue types, ensure field mappings point to correct JIRA fields
_CUSTOM_FIELDS: If custom fields not working: Double-check field ID format (customfield_XXXXX), verify field exists in your JIRA instance, ensure field is populated on issues
_FOOTER: After you save settings in the app, all fields starting with underscore (_) will be removed - they are just comments to help you understand this file. The app only uses the actual configuration values.
